issues.title: Full suite command does NOT run all tiers
issues.why: Documentation claims `pytest tests/ -v` runs the full suite (~10 min, all tiers), but this is incorrect. The addopts in pytest.ini include `-m "not slow and not medium"` which is ALWAYS applied, even when specifying a test path. Testing confirms: `pytest tests/` collects 403 tests (12 deselected), same as default. Only `pytest -m ""` collects all 415 tests. Developers following the documented pre-PR command are unknowingly skipping 12 tests.
issues.fix: Change `pytest tests/ -v` to `pytest -m "" -v` or `pytest --override-ini="addopts=--showlocals --tb=short --strict-markers" -v`. Also update pytest.ini comment on line 15 which has the same incorrect guidance.
issues.verify: Run: `pytest --collect-only -q | tail -3` vs `pytest -m "" --collect-only -q | tail -3` - you'll see 403 vs 415 tests collected

issues.title: Comment claims pytest tests/ runs all tiers - incorrect
issues.why: Comment says 'Full suite: use `pytest tests/ -v` for all tiers' but addopts `-m "not slow and not medium"` is always applied. This creates false confidence that the full suite is being run.
issues.fix: Update comment to: `# Full suite: use `pytest -m "" -v` for all tiers (overrides default marker filter)`

issues.title: Tier time descriptions inconsistent between files
issues.why: pytest.ini line 3 says fast tests are '<1s each' (per-test metric). conftest.py line 5 says '<2 min total' (aggregate metric). These aren't contradictory but the mixed metrics could confuse developers trying to classify their tests. Should be consistent.
issues.fix: Use consistent metrics. Suggest: pytest.ini for canonical definitions (per-test), conftest.py docstring for aggregate expectations. Add comment clarifying: 'Individual tests <1s, suite total <2 min'
issues.verify: Read pytest.ini line 3 and conftest.py line 5 side by side
